Uses of Package
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

  • Classes in harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib used by harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib 
    Class Description
    ILogger
    Simple (maybe too simple in this release) interface used by other TombolaLib objects to trace their activities both during the card series generation phase (ISetFactory objects) and the simulated/assisted tombola games (TGame objects). An interface is used to let TombolaLib users to provide their custom implementation of ILogger objects. Currently the library provide a first practical implementation (see TSimpleLogger) to log on plain text files or on standard console output.
    ILogger.TLogLevel
    As usual, define the discrete "levels" of importance for messages passed to Ilogger instances, in order to prioritize them and decide if they must be logged or not based on the log level set for each logger.
    ISetFactory
    This is the common interface implemented by all Set of Series generation algorithm classes included in the TombolaLib library.
    ISetFactory.TStatus
    Enum definition used to maintain the status of the generation algorithm
    TAbstractSetFactory
    Abstract class providing standard, basic implementation of common methods for the ISetFactory interface.
    TAward
    A TAward object has a category (AMBO = two number in a row, TERNO = three number in a row, ... up to TOMBOLA 15 numbers matched on a card) and represent a prize cards can win playing the game. TAward objects should be prepared before a game starts and collected in a TAwardList object, where they must be arranged in ascending order to let TGame methods work properly.
    TAward.TAwardStatus
    Possible award statuses used by TGame methods while checking is one or more cards have won an award following each number extraction.
    TAwardList
    Helper list class maintaining the ascending ordered list of prizes used in a tombola game.
    TCard
    A TCard instance plays the role of a single "cartella" in the traditional Italian game of Tombola. Each card is composed by 15 numbers, randomly chosen in the range [1..90] and placed on a grid of 3 rows by 9 columns, scattered so that on each row there are 4 empty spaces and 5 numbers each one belonging to a different tens.
    TCardFormat
    Used to specify the String format that is possible to use to visualize a card or save it in files.
    TCardList
    TCardList is an ArrayList specialization class helping to collect together set of cards and specifically to manage them during tombola games. During the cards generation processes, it is preferable to manage cards in groups of six of them, called series, thus TSeriesList objects target this need. During a game, instead, cards must be managed one at a time and TCardList objects are here to serve. In TCardList class are also implemented import methods and constructors to convert a TSeriesList object to a TCardList one.
    TGame
    TombolaGame class is a funny piece of code, where a Tombola game match can be simulated, monitored, controlled and analyzed. I like it very much! It is another piece of magic for me!
    TGameLogEntry.TLogLevel  
    TGameResultCode
    Enum class used mainly by TGame.extractNumber(int) and TGame.resolveCandidates(int) methods to notify the result of their invocation to the TombolaLib users in a defined, controlled and finite way.
    TGameStatus
    Enum class used by TGame to maintain the status of the game, thus allowing or disabling possible game operations in each status.
    THtmlTemplate.THtmlTemplateType  
    TMakeSix
    Here some magic creation happens! TMakeSix is the class implementing the algorithm to prepare six TCard objects in a coordinated way, so that they compose a series of cards, a group of six cards using all 90 numbers of the game so they do not have duplicates.  Special thanks to the "Doc" for the great idea, years and years ago. The algorithm can be considered 'heuristic', using a random number generator.
    TNumberCell
    This is just a simple Java POJO or data object used to access tombola cards elements in a "JavaBean friendly" environment, such as a JavaServer Faces based web application. It simply stores a card number together with its gaming attributes (if it has been already matched or not, if it is a jolly number). TCard and TBillboardCard objects can provide a grid of TNumberCell object as an alternative view of themselves just to be used in such web application...
    TSacchetto
    A TSacchetto object behaves exactly as the ballot box ('sacchetto', in Italian language) that contains the 90 figures of the Tombola game and is used to extract them one at a time before mark each number on the Tombola billboard ('Tabellone').
    TSeries
    TSeries objects represent series of six cards made using all 90 numbers of the Tombola, thus having no equal number between them. Besides, There are also methods to compare cards of a series versus cards of another series, checking how is the maximum of equal numbers between cards or rows.
    TSeriesList
    This class is used to collect series of cards, as they are generated by ISetFactory objects. Each series of card contains 6 cards having no number in common.
    TSeriesList.TLabelingModes
    List the supported choices you have to number cards when preparing their labels
    TSeriesListStats
    TSeriesListStats is an helper data structure class used to collect basic information about the "quality" of a list of series of cards object. For a given TListSeries object, a TSeriesListStats collects how many cards there are that have X numbers equal to another card within the same series list (for each X in [0, 15]) and many cards there are that have at least one row with Y numbers equals to at least one row on another card within the same series list (for each Y in [0, 5]). Maybe this is not a super-elegant class or solution an in next releases I'll find the time to improve it...
    TSimpleLogger
    TSimpleLogger is a quite simple class helping to manage the important task of take trace (that is, log) of actions made by all maior TombolaLib methods. I know I could have chosen to use many beautiful, complex, logger solutions and packages already available for Java, but I preferred to reduce to the minimum external dependencies and keep things as simple as possible. Main principles to use this class and its objects follows: Each library user can prepare his own logger objects using one of the overloaded static TSimpleLogger.prepareLogger(java.lang.String, harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.ILogger.TLogLevel, java.io.PrintStream) method available.
    TTombolaRuntimeException
    Helper class derived from RuntimeException used to identify all runtime Tombola-Specific exceptions raised by TombolaLib library methods.
